availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Johnson (Louisville, Kentucky, (traveling) methodist minister)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, Methodist minister. Pennsylvania native. Married to Eveline Hutchins Johnson in Mason County, Kentucky, on March 19, 1861. Father of Edward S. Johnson. Charged with breach of peace in the Magoffin County Court in 1860. Remitted by Governor Beriah Magoffin on January 26, 1861. Minister in Mason County in 1861. Methodist minister in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1865. Served in the 12th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as chaplain from December 19, 1864, to July 11, 1865. Served in the 13th United States Colored Heavy Artillery Regiment as chaplain from August 18, 1865, to November 18, 1865.

ab.bibl:
